title: [SOLVED]820-2914 Backlight but no display
message:
Hi, we recieved a 2914 with LVDS damage and so we replaced the LVDS
We now have 33v on backlight output, but the screen remains black.

We have tried another screen assembly, same results. 
We have 3v3 at L9000 as we should, and U9000 is functioning normally.
L9010 and L9011 have been replaced with no difference.
Ive also tried a new Bios just encase (as i have seen this due to bad efi before)

Starting to think maybe gmux?  :/

title: [SOLVED]820-2914 Backlight but no display
message: BKL_PWM measured? Put back original BIOS and do a few PRAM resets!

title: [SOLVED]820-2914 Backlight but no display
message:
PWM is 1.6V
The original bios was put back and i have done some pram's
no change in behaviour.

title: [SOLVED]820-2914 Backlight but no display
message: Uhh you say backlight and no image but with 1.6V on PWM I doubt there is even backlight. So what is the issue, no BKL or no image?

title: [SOLVED]820-2914 Backlight but no display
message:
Duke it has 33v on backlight output (at the LVDS) i ran PRAM resets, and it went up to 35V. 
The screen remains black with the backlight present. As far as i can see its probably a fried GMUX. The machine came in with physical damage to the LVDS. all we did was replace the LVDS, should be a simple repair.

title: [SOLVED]820-2914 Backlight but no display
message: You have checked the data lines back to he GMUX right ?

title: [SOLVED]820-2914 Backlight but no display
message:
How should i check them?
i havent checked the traces for continuity to the gmux.
I have checked all GMUX related resistors though.

title: [SOLVED]820-2914 Backlight but no display
message: Check all LVDS lines at the LCD connector on diode mode.

title: [SOLVED]820-2914 Backlight but no display
message: OL on LVDS_CONN_B_CLK_F_N takes me right back to thinking its the gmux. Compared against another 2914 board and got different results. Will change the gmux and report back.

title: [SOLVED]820-2914 Backlight but no display
message: Why not give me the readings to make sure. Swapping a GMUX is a pretty shitty job.

title: [SOLVED]820-2914 Backlight but no display
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 23672"]Why not give me the readings to make sure. Swapping a GMUX is a pretty shitty job.[/QUOTE]

Yeah, i got a misprinted stencil, so im balling them by hand takes me about 25 minutes start to finish which sucks. 
Anyway, Gmux replaced and board is now fully functioning.
Thanks
